definition[0]: having a strong desire to do something, so that you will not let anyone stop you
example[0]: Gwen is a very determined woman.
example[2]: He was determined that the same mistakes would not be repeated.
definition[1]: showing determination, especially in a difficult situation
example[3]: The library was closed down despite determined opposition.
example[4]: She was making a determined effort to give up smoking.
definition[2]: if you are determined to do something, you have decided that you are definitely going to do it, and you will not let anything stop you. Determined  is also used about someone’s character, when they usually behave in this way
example[5]: I was determined to be a doctor.
definition[3]: determined not to change what you are doing, especially when other people think you are behaving in an unreasonable way. Stubborn  is often used when you disapprove of someone. It is also sometimes used when you admire them
example[7]: I wish you would stop being so stubborn!
definition[4]: someone who is single-minded  works very hard in order to achieve one particular thing, and thinks that everything else is much less important
example[9]: During a war, a leader must be single-minded and, if necessary, ruthless.
definition[5]: determined to succeed, even if a situation is difficult or frightening
example[11]: In competitive sports, it is as important to be mentally tough as it is to be physically fit.
example[12]: Gorelick is known as a tough manager.
definition[6]: showing by your behaviour that you are determined not to change your mind, especially when you are telling someone what to do
example[13]: What this country needs is firm leadership.
example[14]: You have to be firm with young children.
definition[7]: determined and full of energy, and not afraid to say what you think and argue with people – used especially when you admire this person. Feisty is often used about women
example[15]: In the film she plays a feisty young woman who is smarter than all the men put together.
example[16]: a feisty kid with a mind of his own
definition[8]: determined to do what you want, without listening to other people’s advice or thinking about the results of your actions – used especially about young people
example[18]: Her sister was headstrong and impulsive, and made a point of going out whenever and wherever she liked.
definition[9]: doing something in a very determined way because you have very strong beliefs, aims etc
example[19]: the soldiers’ resolute defence of the town
definition[10]: determined and refusing to give up
example[20]: McTaggart was seen by many in the environment movement as a tenacious hero.
definition[11]: dogged behaviour shows that you are very determined and that you will not give up – used especially in the following phrases
example[22]: The team played with dogged determination.
example[23]: his dogged refusal to admit defeat
example[24]: the dogged persistence of the defenders
definition[12]: continuing to do something, although this is difficult, or other people warn you not to do it
example[25]: If you want to get a job, you have to be persistent. Don’t give up.
definition[13]: always very determined to do what you want to do, even if other people think it is not a good idea to do it
example[26]: She has always been a strong-willed child.
definition[14]: someone who is ruthless is so determined to get what they want, that they do not care if they harm other people
example[28]: He was ruthless in his ambition.
definition[15]: to be determined to do something and show other people that you are determined to do it, even if it involves harming someone
example[29]: The one-day strike proved that the union meant business.
